parameters.name: InternalWSs
parameters.query:
SecurityIncident
| take 1
| parse IncidentUrl with * "/workspaces/" Workspace "/" *
| project Workspace

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.query:
where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| project value =id, label = name, selected = iff(name =~ '{InternalWSs}', true, false)

parameters.name: InternalRG
parameters.query:
where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| where id =~  "{Workspace}"
| project resourceGroup

parameters.name: resourceGroup
parameters.label: Resource group
parameters.query:
Resources
| summarize Count = count() by subscriptionId, resourceGroup
| order by Count desc
| extend Rank = row_number()
| project value = strcat('/subscriptions/', subscriptionId, '/resourceGroups/', resourceGroup), label = resourceGroup, selected = false

parameters.name: Help
parameters.label: Show Help
parameters.description: This will show some help information to help you understand the page you are on

content.json:
Use this section to see all the servers (either from Azure, other clouds, on-prem and Arc enabled (prerequisite to install the Azure Monitoring agent) under the selected subscription.
Use the Subscription and Resource group filters to narrow down your results.

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == ""
| where type == "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines"
| summarize TotalCountofVMs = count()
content.title: Current VMs in {Subscription:label}

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where isempty(_ResourceId) == true or ResourceProvider =~ "microsoft.hybridcompute"
| distinct Computer
| summarize count()
content.title: Arc or non-Azure with Heartbeat

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' 
| extend Computer = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id) 
| summarize count()
content.title: Machines with MMA

content.query:
resources 
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent' 
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id) 
| summarize count() by AzureVM, ArcVM, subscriptionId, resourceGroup 
| project AzureVM, ArcVM, resourceGroup
| summarize count()
content.title: Machines with AMA

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or  type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' or name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent'
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)
| summarize count() by AzureVM=tolower(AzureVM), ArcVM=tolower(ArcVM), subscriptionId, resourceGroup 
| extend hasBoth = iff(count_ > 1, 'Yes', 'No') | where count_ > 1 
|where hasBoth == 'Yes' 
| summarize count()
content.title: Machines with Both Agents

links.linkLabel: Azure or Arc machines with MMA
Machines with Both Agents under any RG
Non-Azure or hybrid VMs under any RG reporting to {Workspace:label} in the last 30d

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == ""
| where type == "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines"
| extend PowerStatus = properties.extended.instanceView.powerState.displayStatus,
	OSType = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType
| project name, VM=id, location, ResourceGroup=resourceGroup, PowerStatus, OSType
| join kind=leftouter (
resources
| where type contains "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions" and (name == "MicrosoftMonitoringAgent" or name == "OmsAgentForLinux" or name == "MMAExtension")
| parse id with * "/virtualMachines/" ComputerName "/" *
| extend extensionType = properties.type, 
	status = properties.provisioningState,
	version = properties.typeHandlerVersion
| project ComputerName, MMA = name, status, version
) on $left.name == $right.ComputerName
| join kind=leftouter (
resources
| where type contains "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions" and (name == "AzureMonitorWindowsAgent" or name == "AzureMonitorLinuxAgent")
| parse id with * "/virtualMachines/" ComputerName "/" *
| extend extensionType = properties.type, 
	status = properties.provisioningState,
	version = properties.typeHandlerVersion
| project ComputerName, AMA = name, status, version
) on $left.name == $right.ComputerName
content.noDataMessage: No Azure Virtual Machines in the selected subscriptions. Please select the subscription(s) that contain your virtual machine(s)

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where ResourceProvider == "Microsoft.HybridCompute" and _ResourceId != ""
| summarize LastHeartBeat = arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId
| extend TimeFromNow = now() - LastHeartBeat
| extend ["TimeAgo"] = strcat(case(TimeFromNow < 2m, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' seconds'), TimeFromNow < 2h, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' minutes'), TimeFromNow < 2d, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1h), ' hours'), strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1d), ' days')), ' ago')
| project LastHeartBeat, ["Time"]=strcat('ðŸ•’ ', TimeAgo), _ResourceId, ResourceGroup, Computer, ManagementGroupName, OSName, Agent=Category, Version=Version
content.title: Arc machines within {Subscription:label}

content.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
| extend provisioningState = properties.provisioningState,
	status = properties.status,
	agentVersion = properties.agentVersion,
	lastStatusChange = properties.lastStatusChange,
	errorDetails = properties.errorDetails,
	osName = properties.osName,
	osSku = properties.osSku
| extend name = tolower(name)
| project id, name, location, resourceGroup, provisioningState, status, agentVersion, lastStatusChange, osName, osSku
| join kind=leftouter (
resources
| where type contains "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions" and (name == "MicrosoftMonitoringAgent" or name == "OmsAgentForLinux" or name == "OMSAgentForLinux")
| parse id with * "/machines/" ComputerName "/" *
| extend extensionType = properties.type, 
	status = properties.provisioningState,
	version = properties.typeHandlerVersion
| extend ComputerName = tolower(ComputerName)
| project ComputerName, name, status, version
| order by ComputerName, name
) on $left.name == $right.ComputerName
| join kind=leftouter (
resources
| where type contains "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions" and (name == "AzureMonitorWindowsAgent" or name == "AzureMonitorLinuxAgent")
| parse id with * "/machines/" ComputerName "/" *
| extend extensionType = properties.type, 
	status = properties.provisioningState,
	version = properties.typeHandlerVersion
| extend ComputerName = tolower(ComputerName)
| project ComputerName, name, status, version
| order by ComputerName, name
) on $left.name == $right.ComputerName
content.noDataMessage: No Arc-enabled Virtual Machines in the selected subscriptions. Please select the subscription(s) that contain your Arc-enabled virtual machine(s)

content.title: {$rowCount} Azure Arc-enabled servers
content.noDataMessage: No Arc-enabled Virtual Machines with a relationship to the selected workspace. Please select the workspace that contain your Arc-enabled virtual machine(s)

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == "" 
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' 
| extend Server = extract('(.*)/extensions',1,id)
| extend Subscription = extract('(/subscriptions/.*)/resource.*',1,id)
| summarize count() by Server, subscriptionId, resourceGroup, Subscription
| project Server, resourceGroup, Subscription
| sort by Server asc
content.title: Azure or Arc machines with MMA

content.query:
resources 
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent' 
| extend VM = extract('(/subscriptions.*)/extensions',1,id)
| extend Subscription = extract('(/subscriptions/.*)/resource.*',1,id)
| summarize count() by VM, subscriptionId, resourceGroup, Subscription
| project VM, resourceGroup, Subscription
| sort by VM asc
content.title: Machines with AMA

content.query:
resources
| where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or  type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' or name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent'
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualmachines|virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)
| summarize count() by AzureVM=tolower(AzureVM), ArcVM=tolower(ArcVM), subscriptionId, resourceGroup 
| extend hasBoth = iff(count_ > 1, 'Yes', 'No') | where count_ > 1 
| join (resources | where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == "" | where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' 
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualmachines|virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)) on AzureVM  
| project AzureVM, ArcVM, resourceGroup, MMAVersion=name, hasBoth
content.title: Machines with Both Agents under any RG
Non-Azure or hybrid VMs under any RG reporting to {Workspace:label} in the last 30d

content.query: {"version":"ARMEndpoint/1.0","data":null,"headers":[],"method":"GET","path":"/subscriptions/{Subscription2:Id}/providers/Microsoft.Insights/dataCollectionRules","urlParams":[{"key":"api-version","value":"2019-11-01-preview"}],"batchDisabled":false,"transformers":[{"type":"jsonpath","settings":{"tablePath":"$.value","columns":[{"path":"name","columnid":"Name"},{"path":"$..workspaceResourceId","columnid":"Workspace"},{"path":"kind","columnid":"OS"},{"path":"properties.dataFlows[*].streams[0]","columnid":"Streams","substringRegexMatch":"(Microsoft-)*(\\w+)","substringReplace":"$2"},{"path":"$..xPathQueries","columnid":"xPath"},{"path":"location","columnid":"Location"},{"path":"$..facilityNames","columnid":"SyslogFacilities"}]}}]}
content.title: Get all DCRs under {Subscription:label}

content.query:
resources
| where type has 'microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules'
| extend Subscription = extract('(/subscriptions/.*)/resource.*',1,id)
| project name, Subscription, resourceGroup

content.json:
Use this section to see all the DCRs under the selected subscription. You will find Streams and the xPath query.
The stream will normally match the destination table in the Microsoft Sentinel workspace. If it starts with "Microsoft-", the destination table is what comes after. For example, if the stream says "Microsoft-Perf", then the destination table is "Perf".
Click on the DCRs to see associated VMs.

content.title: Select a DCR to view associated VMs

content.query: {"version":"ARMEndpoint/1.0","data":null,"headers":[],"method":"GET","path":"/subscriptions/{Subscription2:Id}/resourceGroups/{DCRrg}/providers/Microsoft.Insights/dataCollectionRules/{DCR}/associations","urlParams":[{"key":"api-version","value":"2019-11-01-preview"}],"batchDisabled":false,"transformers":[{"type":"jsonpath","settings":{"tablePath":"$.value","columns":[{"path":"id","columnid":"VMs","columnType":"string","substringRegexMatch":"(\\/subscriptions.*)(\\/providers.*|Providers.*)","substringReplace":"$1"}]}}]}
content.title: VMs associated to the selected DCR
content.noDataMessage: No VMs found or no DCR selected above

content.title: View all VMs with AMA under the {Subscription:label} subscription and their data collection rules

content.json: These are all the servers with AMA installed. Select each one individually to see the Data Collection Rules associated to them.</br>You will find information such as what is being collected and to what workspace those logs are being sent. The stream will normally match the destination table in the Microsoft Sentinel workspace. If it starts with "Microsoft-", the destination table is what comes after. For example, if the stream says "Microsoft-Perf", then the destination table is "Perf".</br> To learn more about DCRs, please check https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/data-collection-rule-azure-monitor-agent

content.query:
resources
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' or type has "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"                        
| project Computer=tolower(name)
| join (resources | where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' 
| where name has 'azuremonitorwindowsagent' or name has 'azuremonitorlinuxagent' 
| extend type, temp = extract('virtualmachines|virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), vmid = extract('(/subscriptions/.*achines/.*)(/extensions*)',1,id)
| extend Subscription = extract('(/subscriptions/.*)/resource.*',1,id)
| extend Computer = tolower(temp)
)
on Computer
| union (resources | where type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'azuremonitorwindowsagent' or name has 'azuremonitorlinuxagent'
| extend id, Computer = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), vmid = extract('(/subscriptions/.*achines/.*)(/extensions*)',1,id))
| project vmid, Computer, resourceGroup, location, Subscription
content.title: Get Azure and hybrid VMs with AMA

items.name: Azure and hybrid VMs with AMA

content.query:
resources 
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent' 
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id) 
| summarize count() by AzureVM, ArcVM, subscriptionId, resourceGroup 
| project AzureVM, ArcVM, resourceGroup

items.name: Azure or Arc machines with AMA

content.json:
Below you can find the number of events submitted by the selected VM to some of the main native tables in Microsoft Sentinel and Log Analytics.
The first graph includes events logged in the tables: SecurityEvent, Heartbeat, Perf and Event.
The second graph shows the number of events forwarded by the selected VM to the WindowsEvent table if you are using the Windows Forwarded Events connector.
Note that if the selected VM also has MMA installed, the logs could come from either one of the agents, AMA or MMA

content.query:
SecurityEvent | union Heartbeat, Event, Perf
| extend _ResourceId, WEC = extract('Machines|machines/(.*)',1,_ResourceId)
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange} and Computer == "{vmname}" or WEC == "{vmname}"
| summarize count()  by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d), Type
| project Table=Type, TimeGenerated, count_
content.title: {TimeRange:label}: Number of events in {Workspace:label} in for {vmname} in the SecurityEvent, Heartbeat, Perf or Event tables

content.query:
WindowsEvent
| extend _ResourceId, WEC = extract('Machines|machines/(.*)',1,_ResourceId)
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange} and WEC == "{vmname}"
| summarize count()  by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| project TimeGenerated, count_
content.title: {TimeRange:label}: Number of WEF events in {Workspace:label} forwarded by {vmname} to the WindowsEvent table
